solution.text:
Inserting n numbers between any numbers a and b makes b the \(n+2^{th}\) term
i.e. \(b=ar^{(n+2)-1}=ar^{n+1}\)
Where r is the common difference of the new G.P.
\(r=(\frac{b}{a})^{\frac{1}{n+1}}\)
therefore the second term will be
\(a_2=ar=a(\frac{b}{a})^{\frac{1}{n+1}}\)
\(a_2=_{{p*q}}_\)

content.text: Find the 2nd term of the G.P formed when you insert _{p}_ numbers between _{q}_ and _{{q*r**(p+1)}}_ .
